title: Maya king Yuknoom Yich'aak K'ahk' assumes the crown of Calakmul.
text: Maya king Yuknoom Yich'aak K'ahk' assumes the crown of Calakmul.

title: King Louis the Pious captures Barcelona from the Moors after a siege of several months.
text: King Louis the Pious captures Barcelona from the Moors after a siege of several months.

title: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England.
text: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England.

title: The first Parliament of Friuli is created.
text: The first Parliament of Friuli is created.

title: The Peace of Cateau-Cambrésis treaty is signed, ending the Italian Wars.
text: The Peace of Cateau-Cambrésis treaty is signed, ending the Italian Wars.

title: The generals in the Greek War of Independence stand trial for treason.
text: The generals in the Greek War of Independence stand trial for treason.

title: The first successful United States Pony Express run from St. Joseph, Missouri, to Sacramento, California, begins.
text: The first successful United States Pony Express run from St. Joseph, Missouri, to Sacramento, California, begins.

title: American Civil War: Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America.
text: American Civil War: Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America.

title: American Old West: Robert Ford kills Jesse James.
text: American Old West: Robert Ford kills Jesse James.

title: Gottlieb Daimler is granted a German patent for his engine design.
text: Gottlieb Daimler is granted a German patent for his engine design.

title: The first of eleven unsolved brutal murders of women committed in or near the impoverished Whitechapel district in the East End of London, occurs.
text: The first of eleven unsolved brutal murders of women committed in or near the impoverished Whitechapel district in the East End of London, occurs.

title: The trial in the libel case brought by Oscar Wilde begins, eventually resulting in his imprisonment on charges of homosexuality.
text: The trial in the libel case brought by Oscar Wilde begins, eventually resulting in his imprisonment on charges of homosexuality.

title: Joseph Stalin becomes the first General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
text: Joseph Stalin becomes the first General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

title: First flight over Mount Everest, a British expedition, led by the Marquis of Clydesdale, and funded by Lucy, Lady Houston.
text: First flight over Mount Everest, a British expedition, led by the Marquis of Clydesdale, and funded by Lucy, Lady Houston.

title: Bruno Richard Hauptmann is executed for the kidnapping and death of Charles Augustus Lindbergh, Jr., the baby son of pilot Charles Lindbergh.
text: Bruno Richard Hauptmann is executed for the kidnapping and death of Charles Augustus Lindbergh, Jr., the baby son of pilot Charles Lindbergh.

title: World War II: Japanese forces begin an assault on the United States and Filipino troops on the Bataan Peninsula.
text: World War II: Japanese forces begin an assault on the United States and Filipino troops on the Bataan Peninsula.

title: Japanese Lt. General Masaharu Homma is executed in the Philippines for leading the Bataan Death March.
text: Japanese Lt. General Masaharu Homma is executed in the Philippines for leading the Bataan Death March.

title: Cold War: U.S. President Harry S. Truman signs the Marshall Plan, authorizing $5 billion in aid for 16 countries.
text: Cold War: U.S. President Harry S. Truman signs the Marshall Plan, authorizing $5 billion in aid for 16 countries.

title: In Jeju Province, South Korea, a civil-war-like period of violence and human rights abuses begins, known as the Jeju uprising.
text: In Jeju Province, South Korea, a civil-war-like period of violence and human rights abuses begins, known as the Jeju uprising.

title: The American Civil Liberties Union announces it will defend Allen Ginsberg's book Howl against obscenity charges.
text: The American Civil Liberties Union announces it will defend Allen Ginsberg's book Howl against obscenity charges.

title: Hudsonville–Standale tornado: The western half of the Lower Peninsula of Michigan is struck by a deadly F5 tornado.
text: Hudsonville–Standale tornado: The western half of the Lower Peninsula of Michigan is struck by a deadly F5 tornado.

title: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his "I've Been to the Mountaintop" speech. He was assassinated the next day.
text: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his "I've Been to the Mountaintop" speech. He was assassinated the next day.

title: Vietnam War: United States Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird announces that the United States will start to "Vietnamize" the war effort.
text: Vietnam War: United States Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird announces that the United States will start to "Vietnamize" the war effort.

title: Martin Cooper of Motorola makes the first handheld mobile phone call to Joel S. Engel of Bell Labs.
text: Martin Cooper of Motorola makes the first handheld mobile phone call to Joel S. Engel of Bell Labs.

title: The 1974 Super Outbreak occurs, the second biggest tornado outbreak in recorded history (after the 2011 Super Outbreak). The death toll is 315, with nearly 5,500 injured.
text: The 1974 Super Outbreak occurs, the second biggest tornado outbreak in recorded history (after the 2011 Super Outbreak). The death toll is 315, with nearly 5,500 injured.

title: Bobby Fischer refuses to play in a chess match against Anatoly Karpov, giving Karpov the title of World Champion by default.
text: Bobby Fischer refuses to play in a chess match against Anatoly Karpov, giving Karpov the title of World Champion by default.

title: The Osborne 1, the first successful portable computer, is unveiled at the West Coast Computer Faire in San Francisco.
text: The Osborne 1, the first successful portable computer, is unveiled at the West Coast Computer Faire in San Francisco.

title: Suspected "Unabomber" Theodore Kaczynski is captured at his Montana cabin in the United States.
text: Suspected "Unabomber" Theodore Kaczynski is captured at his Montana cabin in the United States.

title: The Thalit massacre begins in Algeria; all but one of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.
text: The Thalit massacre begins in Algeria; all but one of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.

title: United States v. Microsoft Corp.: Microsoft is ruled to have violated United States antitrust law by keeping "an oppressive thumb" on its competitors.
text: United States v. Microsoft Corp.: Microsoft is ruled to have violated United States antitrust law by keeping "an oppressive thumb" on its competitors.

title: Islamic terrorists involved in the 2004 Madrid train bombings are trapped by the police in their apartment and kill themselves.
text: Islamic terrorists involved in the 2004 Madrid train bombings are trapped by the police in their apartment and kill themselves.

title: Conventional-Train World Speed Record: A French TGV train on the LGV Est high speed line sets an official new world speed record.
text: Conventional-Train World Speed Record: A French TGV train on the LGV Est high speed line sets an official new world speed record.

title: ATA Airlines, once one of the ten largest U.S. passenger airlines and largest charter airline, files for bankruptcy for the second time in five years and ceases all operations.
text: ATA Airlines, once one of the ten largest U.S. passenger airlines and largest charter airline, files for bankruptcy for the second time in five years and ceases all operations.

title: Texas law enforcement cordons off the FLDS's YFZ Ranch. Eventually 533 women and children will be taken into state custody.
text: Texas law enforcement cordons off the FLDS's YFZ Ranch. Eventually 533 women and children will be taken into state custody.

title: Jiverly Antares Wong opens fire at the American Civic Association immigration center in Binghamton, New York, killing thirteen and wounding four before committing suicide.
text: Jiverly Antares Wong opens fire at the American Civic Association immigration center in Binghamton, New York, killing thirteen and wounding four before committing suicide.

title: Apple Inc. released the first generation iPad, a tablet computer.
text: Apple Inc. released the first generation iPad, a tablet computer.

title: More than 50 people die in floods resulting from record-breaking rainfall in La Plata and Buenos Aires, Argentina.
text: More than 50 people die in floods resulting from record-breaking rainfall in La Plata and Buenos Aires, Argentina.

title: The Panama Papers, a leak of legal documents, reveals information on 214,488 offshore companies.

title: A bomb explodes in the St Petersburg metro system, killing 14 and injuring several more people.
text: A bomb explodes in the St Petersburg metro system, killing 14 and injuring several more people.
